text: a diplomatic graveyard after numerous
attempts at peace falling one by one for
decades that is what many people call
Cyprus but could there be an end to the
conflict in sight here in their work
your technologies Turkish Cypriot leader
Mustafa akinci told me the time has come
for a United Cyprus we need to set up a
united federal country now after 50
years of separation it is high time that
we are able to create a better future
for our younger generations that to
develop peace culture to develop federal
culture and to prepare a brighter future
for them Cyprus has been divided along
ethnic lines since 1974 when turkey
occupied its northern third in
retaliation for a greek-inspired coup
the Turkish Cypriot state founded in the
north is recognized only by Ankara
whereas the Greek Cypriot state is a
member of the EU peace talks are
currently underway in Geneva but there
are hurdles ahead security the presence
of the Turkish military on the island a
rotating presidency between two
communities just some of the biggest
concerns but mr. attinger does not want
to contemplate failure if we try to
speak about P lambie's and so on and so
forth of course this
might create suspicion in the minds of
other people saying that the target site
has other plans they don't really mean
business this is not the case we will do
our best with all our determination we
will focus for a solution but if we go
again to the referenda and we get
another no vote from the Greeks applause
because you cannot stop the life like
many of the protesters last night in
Nicosia mr. Akagi believes these talks
could be the last opportunity to bring
peace to the divided island of Cyprus
the younger generations I believe that
they they will not focus on a federal
set up in the future because they are
growing for a part they are becoming
aliens in their own country they are
like tourists visiting each other's side
and they don't share a common vision for
the future it is the last trial of our
generation most horribly
last chance for a federation
